title: A Noise-Robust Turn-Taking System for Real-World Dialogue Robots: A Field Experiment
author: Koji Inoue (Kyoto University), Yuki Okafuji (CyberAgent, Osaka University), Jun Baba (CyberAgent, Osaka University), Yoshiki Ohira (CyberAgent, Osaka University), Katsuya Hyodo (CyberAgent, Osaka University), Tatsuya Kawahara (Kyoto University)
relevance_why: The proposed noise-robust voice activity projection (VAP) system can enhance dialogue interaction quality in practical applications, which connects to Dr. Liu's work in audio processing and generative models.
background: Deploying dialogue robots in environments with background noise to improve turn-taking and conversational fluency during human-robot interaction.
contribution: This paper introduces a noise-robust voice activity projection model to solve issues related to turn-taking in noisy settings, achieving significantly reduced response latency and improved user satisfaction.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional speech recognition techniques often fail in noisy environments, leading to delays and poor interaction quality.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work replaces conventional methods with a locally processed, end-to-end voice activity prediction model that actively predicts user speech activity.

key_innovation: Combines real-time processing with a predictive modeling approach to improve dialogue interactivity despite environmental noise.
real_world_impact: The findings support the deployment of more responsive dialogue systems in noisy public environments, enhancing user experience. This could adapt to other contexts involving audio and speech interactions.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.voice activity projection (VAP): **Voice activity projection (VAP)** is a predictive model designed to estimate future voice activity based on current audio input to improve turn-taking in conversations.
